intro: Brachystegia bussei, commonly known as the African brachystegia, is a deciduous tree native to the tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Leguminosae, also known as the Fabaceae family, and is characterized by its compound leaves and pod fruits. The tree typically grows in savanna and woodland habitats, where it plays a vital role in the ecosystem by providing habitat and food for various animals. Its bark is thick and fissured, offering some resistance to drought and insect damage.
